derivation: from a primary but obsolete verb (to veil as a bride;
strongs_def: compare Latin "nupto," to marry); a young married woman (as veiled), including a betrothed girl; by implication, a son's wife
outline:
1. a betrothed woman, a bride
  2. a recently married woman, young wife
  3. a young woman
  4. a daughter-in-law
